website_summaries.verdict: This popular, affordable broom has unique bristles and an ergonomic design for easy cleaning.
pros: 3-piece pole breaks down for convenient storage
Specialized bristles can even sweep up flour
Broom head easily detaches for cleaning
cons: Broom height is on the short side, which will please some but not others

customer_reviews.title: NEW VERSION NOT THE WIRECUTTER VERSION NOT THE ONE IN THE PICTURE.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware this is worse and cheaper than the original version that I previously owned and used for many years. The bristles are not a soft and do a bad job of picking up debris. I'm sending this awful thing right back and ordering the second pick from the wirecutter. What a stupid bait and switch from Casabella Wayclean. They even have the old broom still in the picture.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this since cannot screw pieces together.

customer_reviews.author: Doris Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Handle does not stay together; bristles are soft.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because Wirecutter gave it great reviews. Not so. The handle screws together, and keeps coming apart. I will have to glue it. Bristles are VERY soft; even become misshapen while stored in the closet. The angle of the soft “bristles” is good. I would not buy this again. Don’t waste your money.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Have only had about a month and used only on title in kitchen and started to separate already/ Not happy with the purchase

customer_reviews.title: Just A Good Broom
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of a broom expert and I like this one a lot. We have hardwood floors and although our vacuum is supposed to do a decent job on them, I feel that a broom really works best. This one has the "frayed gray bristles" that I feel are the most effective type of bristle available. It is shaped well and has a good length. Just a good broom.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Mackay

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a great broom with soft bristles. My only issue is that it screws together mid-brush and after use, it has loosened and comes apart. It simply takes re-tightening, but is a slight nuisance compared to a traditional broom. If it didn’t have this, it would be a perfect broom.
customer_reviews.author: Talisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gym broom
customer_reviews.text: Nice broom. Easy to connect the extension stick handles. I bought this to sweep my at home gym floor pads. Works perfectly. The bottom is made from soft plastic bristles which is better than the Asian brooms. If you sweep textured foam pads with the Asian broom you will be left with particles of plant bristles. Plastic bristles are the way to go. This broom is also very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond V.

customer_reviews.title: Great broom except for one tiny thing
customer_reviews.text: This broom really gets the stuff off my deck. It's the best broom I have bought in many years except for one thing: It comes in three parts that screw together. The end of the handle twists into a second part of the broom stem and that twists into the actual sweep part. And the parts don't stay screwed together, no matter how much you tighten them. So I constantly have to stop sweeping and tighten the parts. It isn't necessary to have moving parts like this on a broom and I guess they did it to make shipping easier - BUT at the VERY LEAST, the parts should CLICK together so that they stay put! Aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: mallory0405

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade from old broom!
customer_reviews.text: I got angry at my old broom. It had big thick bristles that would leave stuff behind. Looked this one up on Wirecutter (I look up all my stuff on that site) and it said give this one a try. Worked out wonderfully. The fine bristles sweep super smoothly. Only issue is the broom twists together in the middle and sometimes it will come apart when you're sweeping. Not a major problem since it's otherwise a great broom.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice broom, but junky handle
customer_reviews.text: I just received this yesterday. First off, I don’t care for how it unscrews itself while you are trying to use it. Secondly, the hanging part on the top of the handle is exactly where my hand goes, so with the pressure of my hand just from sweeping, that part has broken off. Yay. :/ Thirdly....as lovely as the nice comfort grip on the handle is....it’s too far down the handle for a comfortable reach. The broom bristle part is nice and the broom is lightweight. It edges nicely. If I were shorter, it would be a wonderful broom. :/

I like the look of it with the matching dust pan compared to my green and white libman but it has become a nuisance with every use as it disconnects from the base every 2 seconds. I missed the return window but won’t buy from seller again unless they honor an exchange.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sweeper

It’s not a big deal, since it’s simple enough, but can get annoying if I’m doing the whole house and have to stop and adjust a few times. But the bristles are easy to clean off, it’s soft, and lightweight and the best part is it fits in my girl hands—no more red sores or blisters from larger handle wood brooms.
